verses.verse: Now it happened in the third<WH7969> year<WH8141> of Hoshea<WH1954> son<WH1121> of Elah<WH425> king<WH4428> of Israel,<WH3478> that Hezekiah<WH2396> the son<WH1121> of Ahaz<WH271> king<WH4428> of Judah<WH3063> began to reign.<WH4427>

He trusted<WH982> in Yahweh,<WH3068> the God<WH430> of Israel;<WH3478> so that after<WH310> him was none like him among all the kings<WH4428> of Judah,<WH3063> nor among them that were before him.<WH6440>
For he joined<WH1692> with Yahweh;<WH3068> he didn't<WH5493> depart from following<WH310> him,<WH8104> but kept his commandments,<WH4687> which Yahweh<WH3068> commanded<WH6680> Moses.<WH4872>
Yahweh<WH3068> was with him;<WH3318> wherever he went forth he prospered:<WH7919> and he rebelled<WH4775> against the king<WH4428> of Assyria,<WH804> and didn't<WH5647> serve him.
He struck<WH5221> the Philistines<WH6430> to Gaza<WH5804> and its borders,<WH1366> from the tower<WH4026> of the watchmen<WH5341> to the fortified<WH4013> city.<WH5892>

It happened in the fourth<WH7243> year<WH8141> of king<WH4428> Hezekiah,<WH2396> which was the seventh<WH7637> year<WH8141> of Hoshea<WH1954> son<WH1121> of Elah<WH425> king<WH4428> of Israel,<WH3478> that Shalmaneser<WH8022> king<WH4428> of Assyria<WH804> came up<WH5927> against Samaria,<WH8111> and besieged it.<WH6696>

At the end<WH7097> of three<WH7969> years<WH8141> they took<WH3920> it:<WH8337> in the sixth year<WH8141> of Hezekiah,<WH2396> which was the ninth<WH8672> year<WH8141> of Hoshea<WH1954> king<WH4428> of Israel,<WH3478> Samaria<WH8111> was taken.<WH3920>

The king<WH4428> of Assyria<WH804> carried Israel<WH3478> away<WH1540> to Assyria,<WH804> and put<WH5148> them in Halah,<WH2477> and on the Habor,<WH2249> the river<WH5104> of Gozan,<WH1470> and in the cities<WH5892> of the Medes,<WH4074>

because they didn't<WH8085> obey the voice<WH6963> of Yahweh<WH3068> their God,<WH430> but transgressed<WH5674> his covenant,<WH1285> even all that Moses<WH4872> the servant<WH5650> of Yahweh<WH3068> commanded,<WH6680> and would not hear<WH8085> it,<WH6213> nor do it.

Now in the fourteenth<WH702> year<WH8141> of king<WH4428> Hezekiah,<WH2396> Sennacherib<WH5576> king<WH4428> of Assyria<WH804> came up<WH5927> against all the fortified<WH1219> cities<WH5892> of Judah,<WH3063> and took them.<WH8610>

Hezekiah<WH2396> king<WH4428> of Judah<WH3063> sent<WH7971> to the king<WH4428> of Assyria<WH804> to Lachish,<WH3923> saying,<WH559> "I have offended;<WH2398> return<WH7725> from me.<WH5414> That which you put on me,<WH5375> I will bear." The king<WH4428> of Assyria<WH804> appointed<WH7760> to Hezekiah<WH2396> king<WH4428> of Judah<WH3063> three<WH7969> hundred<WH3967> talents<WH3603> of silver<WH3701> and thirty<WH7970> talents<WH3603> of gold.<WH2091>
Hezekiah<WH2396> gave<WH5414> him all the silver<WH3701> that was found<WH4672> in the house<WH1004> of Yahweh,<WH3068> and in the treasures<WH214> of the king<WH4428>'s house.<WH1004>

At that time,<WH6256> Hezekiah<WH2396> cut off<WH7112> the gold from the doors<WH1817> of the temple<WH1964> of Yahweh,<WH3068> and from the pillars<WH547> which Hezekiah<WH2396> king<WH4428> of Judah<WH3063> had overlaid,<WH6823> and gave<WH5414> it to the king<WH4428> of Assyria.<WH804>

The king<WH4428> of Assyria<WH804> sent<WH7971> Tartan<WH8661> and Rabsaris<WH7249> and Rabshakeh<WH7262> from Lachish<WH3923> to king<WH4428> Hezekiah<WH2396> with a great<WH3515> army<WH2426> to Jerusalem.<WH3389> They went up<WH5927> and came<WH935> to Jerusalem.<WH3389> When they had come up,<WH5927> they came<WH935> and stood<WH5975> by the conduit<WH8585> of the upper<WH5945> pool,<WH1295> which is in the highway<WH4546> of the fuller<WH3526>'s field.<WH7704>

When they had called<WH7121> to the king,<WH4428> there came out<WH3318> to them Eliakim<WH471> the son<WH1121> of Hilkiah,<WH2518> who was over the household,<WH1004> and Shebnah<WH7644> the scribe,<WH5608> and Joah<WH3098> the son<WH1121> of Asaph<WH623> the recorder.<WH2142>

Rabshakeh<WH7262> said<WH559> to them,<WH559> "Say now to Hezekiah,<WH2396> <WH559> 'Thus says the great<WH1419> king,<WH4428> the king<WH4428> of Assyria,<WH804> "What confidence<WH986> is this in which you trust?<WH982>

You say<WH559> (but they are but vain<WH8193> words<WH1697>), <WH6098> 'There is counsel and strength<WH1369> for war.<WH4421>' Now on whom do you trust,<WH982> that you have rebelled against me?<WH4775>

Now,<WH982> behold, you trust in the staff<WH4938> of this bruised<WH7533> reed,<WH7070> even in Egypt.<WH4714> If a man<WH376> leans<WH5564> on it,<WH935> it will go into his hand,<WH3709> and pierce<WH5344> it.<WH6547> So is Pharaoh king<WH4428> of Egypt<WH4714> to all who trust on him.<WH982>

But if you tell<WH559> me,<WH982> 'We trust in Yahweh<WH3068> our God;<WH430>' isn't<WH1116> that he whose high places and whose altars<WH4196> Hezekiah<WH2396> has taken away,<WH5493> and has said<WH559> to Judah<WH3063> and to Jerusalem,<WH3389> <WH7812> 'You shall worship before<WH6440> this altar<WH4196> in Jerusalem?<WH3389>'

Now therefore,<WH6148> please give pledges to my master<WH113> the king<WH4428> of Assyria,<WH804> and I will give<WH5414> you two thousand<WH505> horses,<WH5483> if you are able<WH3201> on your part to set<WH5414> riders on them.<WH7392>

How then can you turn away<WH7725> the face<WH6440> of one<WH259> captain<WH6346> of the least<WH6996> of my master<WH113>'s servants,<WH5650> and put your trust<WH982> on Egypt<WH4714> for chariots<WH7393> and for horsemen?<WH6571>

Have I now come up<WH5927> without<WH1107> Yahweh<WH3068> against this place<WH4725> to destroy<WH7843> it?<WH3068> Yahweh said<WH559> to me,<WH5927> 'Go up against this land,<WH776> and destroy it.<WH7843>'"'"

Then Eliakim<WH471> the son<WH1121> of Hilkiah,<WH2518> and Shebnah,<WH7644> and Joah,<WH3098> said<WH559> to Rabshakeh,<WH7262> "Please speak<WH1696> to your servants<WH5650> in the Syrian language;<WH762> for we understand<WH8085> it.<WH1696> Don't speak with us in the Jews<WH3066>' language, in the hearing<WH241> of the people<WH5971> who are on the wall.<WH2346>"

But Rabshakeh<WH7262> said<WH559> to them,<WH113> "Has my master sent<WH7971> me to your master,<WH113> and to you,<WH1696> to speak these words?<WH1697> Hasn't<WH582> he sent me to the men who sit<WH3427> on the wall,<WH2346> to eat<WH398> their own dung,<WH6675> and to drink<WH8354> their own water with you?<WH7272>"

Then Rabshakeh<WH7262> stood,<WH5975> and cried<WH7121> with a loud<WH1419> voice<WH6963> in the Jews<WH3066>' language, and spoke,<WH1696> saying,<WH559> "Hear<WH8085> the word<WH1697> of the great<WH1419> king,<WH4428> the king<WH4428> of Assyria.<WH804>
Thus says<WH559> the king,<WH4428> <WH2396> 'Don't let Hezekiah deceive<WH5377> you;<WH3201> for he will not be able to deliver<WH5337> you out of his hand.<WH3027>

Neither let Hezekiah<WH2396> make you trust<WH982> in Yahweh,<WH3068> saying,<WH559> "Yahweh<WH3068> will surely<WH5337> deliver<WH5337> us,<WH5892> and this city shall not be given<WH5414> into the hand<WH3027> of the king<WH4428> of Assyria.<WH804>"

Don't<WH8085> listen to Hezekiah.<WH2396>' For thus says<WH559> the king<WH4428> of Assyria,<WH804> <WH6213> 'Make your peace<WH1293> with me,<WH3318> and come out to me;<WH376> and everyone of you eat<WH398> of his vine,<WH1612> and everyone<WH376> of his fig tree,<WH8384> and everyone<WH376> drink<WH8354> the waters<WH4325> of his own cistern;<WH953>

until I come<WH935> and take you away<WH3947> to a land<WH776> like your own land,<WH776> a land<WH776> of grain<WH1715> and new wine,<WH8492> a land<WH776> of bread<WH3899> and vineyards,<WH3754> a land<WH776> of olive<WH2132> trees<WH3323> and of honey,<WH1706> that you may live,<WH2421> and not die.<WH4191> Don't<WH8085> listen to Hezekiah,<WH2396> when he persuades<WH5496> you,<WH559> saying, "Yahweh<WH3068> will deliver us.<WH5337>"
Has any<WH376> of the gods<WH430> of the nations<WH1471> ever<WH5337> delivered<WH5337> his land<WH776> out of the hand<WH3027> of the king<WH4428> of Assyria?<WH804>

Where are the gods<WH430> of Hamath,<WH2574> and of Arpad?<WH774> Where are the gods<WH430> of Sepharvaim,<WH5617> of Hena,<WH2012> and Ivvah?<WH5755> Have they delivered<WH5337> Samaria<WH8111> out of my hand?<WH3027>

Who are they among all the gods<WH430> of the countries,<WH776> that have delivered<WH5337> their country<WH776> out of my hand,<WH3027> that Yahweh<WH3068> should deliver<WH5337> Jerusalem<WH3389> out of my hand?<WH3027>'"
But the people<WH5971> held their peace,<WH2790> and answered<WH6030> him not a word;<WH1697> for the king<WH4428>'s commandment<WH4687> was,<WH559> "Don't<WH6030> answer him."

Then Eliakim<WH471> the son<WH1121> of Hilkiah,<WH2518> who was over the household,<WH1004> came<WH935> with Shebna<WH7644> the scribe,<WH5608> and Joah<WH3098> the son<WH1121> of Asaph<WH623> the recorder,<WH2142> to Hezekiah<WH2396> with their clothes<WH899> torn,<WH7167> and told<WH5046> him the words<WH1697> of Rabshakeh.<WH7262>
